casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Benjamin A. CHATMAN, Appellant. ED 106211 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION FOUR. Filed: October 30, 2018 Bobby E. Bailey, 4387 Laclede Avenue, Suite A, St. Louis, MO 63108, Nancy A. McKerrow, 1400 Forum Blvd., Suite 1C #203, Columbia, MO 65203, for appellant. Joshua D. Hawley, Garrick F. D. Aplin, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102, for respondent. Before: Kurt S. Odenwald, P.J., Gary M. Gaertner, Jr., J., and Colleen Dolan, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Benjamin A. Chatman (Defendant) appeals the judgment entered upon his conviction by jury of first-degree murder and armed criminal action. We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and conclude that no reversible error occurred. An extended opinion would serve no jurisprudential purpose. We have, however, provided a memorandum setting forth the reasons for our decision to the parties for their use only. We affirm the judgment pursuant to Missouri Rule of Criminal Procedure 30.25(b).
